titlestmt.titleproper: American Cities, a collection of perspectives
Finding Aid for A Collection of Perspectives of American Cities LSC.0412
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Heather Lowe with assistance from Megan Hahn Fraser in the Center for Primary Research and Training (CFPRT), August 2011; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cub√©.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-07-18 10:58:16 -0700.

did.unittitle: A Collection of Perspectives of American Cities
did.abstract: The collection consists of 8 perspective drawings of aerial views of major United States cities.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], A Collection of Perspectives of American Cities (Collection Number 412). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Note
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.
Processed by Heather Lowe with assistance from Megan Hahn Fraser in the Center for Primary Research and Training (CFPRT), August 2011.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of 8 perspective drawings of American cities created by various architects. The drawings were created in a range of media and stylistic methods common to architectural draftsmanship.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized alphabetically by city name.

did.physdesc: 29 1/2" x 40" ink on paper drawing mounted on 30 x 40" board. Signed in center bottom by the architect (first name unknown).
24 3/8" x 36" graphite on paper drawing mounted on 26 1/2" x 38 1/4" board. Signed and titled in lower right corner by the architect.
23 3/8" x 38" ink on bond paper mounted on 30" x 40" board. Signed in lower left corner by the architect.
25 5/8" x 40" black and white ink on paper drawing. Signed in lower right corner by the architect.
26 1/2" x 40" ink on paper drawing mounted on board. Signed in lower left corner by the architect (first name unknown).
26" x 37 7/8" ink on illustration board. Signed in lower left corner by the architect.
29 5/8" x 39 1/2" ink on vellum. Signed in lower right corner on tape by the artist.

did.unittitle: Unknown Poseidon fountain, F. W. Jamison,
